alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:27AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry and northwestern Brown Counties through 515 AM CDT/415 AM MDT/... At 426 AM CDT/326 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles southeast of Medicine Lake to 23 miles south of Nenzel to 6 miles southeast of Merritt Reservoir to Valentine National Wildlife Refuge to 17 miles southwest of Johnstown. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Cody, Kilgore, Nenzel, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Merritt Reservoir, Crookston, Wood Lake, Steer Creek Campground, Schoolhouse Lake, Sparks, Cody Lake, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River and Big Alkali Lake State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 159 and 222. Highway 97 between mile markers 106 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 180 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
